JobFullDesc: At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision – transforming patients’ lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease – and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry – each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.Reporting to the Cleaning Validation Scientist/Manager or designee, the Senior Specialist will perform duties required to support validation activities and ensure protocols and reports are compliant with BMS requirements.  The Senior Specialist will be responsible for coordination of Cleaning Validation and Mixing Validation activities when required.Duties / Responsibilities:Generate cleanability studies, cleaning verification / validation protocols, and mixing validation protocols.  Execute validation protocols, collect field samples, perform visual inspection of cleaned components / equipment and troubleshoot failures / problems.Coordinate with laboratories and manufacturing personnel to submit and test field samples.Collect and tabulate laboratory data, review laboratory data for errors and discrepancies, and transcribe results into final reports.Generate final reports and investigation reports as necessary, and route documents for approval.Collect historical cleaning data from the site Distributed Control System (DCS), tabulate and analyze data and report on findings on a quarterly basis.Provide swab qualification training to Manufacturing operators and R&D teams and maintain qualification programs. Maintain Cleaning Monitoring program and help ensure management tools/systems and documentation (SOPs, schedules, reports) are up-to-date.   Provide input, generate, review and approve cleaning and mixing validation procedures. Maintain laboratory analytical equipment (e.g. TOC, UV/Vis) according to standard. Develop and defend protocol acceptance criteria using current industry and company accepted standards. Generate risk assessments to discuss the approach to cleaning or mixing related activities.Generate change control documentation for improvements being made to cleaning, mixing, or related automated procedures.Support Method Development activities and review Method Development Documents related to cleaning or mixing laboratory methods. Maintain familiarity with BMS directives and industry guidelines on validation. Be prepared to discuss and defend cleaning and mixing validation documentation to internal Quality representatives as well as representatives of external regulatory authorities. Innovate / Improve upon cleaning or mixing validation systems to increase efficiency and reduce manufacturing delays.Qualifications:BS degree in Engineering, Chemistry, or the Biological Sciences or an AS degree with direct biopharmaceutical validation experience.  Direct experience or close familiarity with validation is desired.  Excellent communication and technical writing skills are required.Physical Demands:This position supports a small scale manufacturing facility with classified areas that require appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE).  There will also be some laboratory work required.  This role will require use of hazardous materials such as caustics, acids, and may use high-temperature steam.  Some bending, twisting, squatting, kneeling, climbing, and reaching may be required.  Role may also require infrequent unassisted lifting (not to exceed 50 lbs).Work Environment:Work will be performed in office, laboratory, and manufacturing environments, and will require both working in teams and alone.  Laboratory and manufacturing areas may include equipment with extreme heat and some walking surfaces may be damp.  Laboratory and manufacturing environments will include working around chemicals such as acids, bases, and bleach.Travel:This position requires
